fields.description:
After Migration done ,we have to check Chart related plugins and their functionalities working condition 
if any issues we found there we have to resolve issues according to new UI Standards

nonEditableReason.message: The Parent Link is only available to Jira Premium users.

comments.body:
!image-20231004-120924.png|width=1843,height=957!

Regarding the test of monet plugins herer are the list
1)sunburst, heatmap, global line chart, Gauge chart,Tree map chart axis are not working
2)there are two gauge chart, pie chart,  customized pie chart,nightingale chart, doughnout chart, customized pie chart,Area chart,Smooth Area Chart,Stacked Area chart,Gradient stacked area chart, Stacekd Line chart,bar with background,stacked horizontal chart,multi bar chart, customized pie chart,funnel chart.
3)stacked polar bar chart- radius is not working
4)stage speed gauge chart- no option of x and y ,grade gauge chart - no option for x and y,progress gauge chart - no option for x and y,temperature gauge chart,gauge barometer chart, multi title gauge chart, Ring gauge chart,Speed Gauge chart  instead name and value are given.
5)treemap chart needs enchancement.

 [~accountid:712020:03d53fb6-c586-4b54-9884-6baa2eef6c21]

fields.description:
Monet is migrated from 1.0 to 2.0 ,after migration while checking plugins we found the issue dependencies is not there , hence we have to migrate the dependencies from prod to Dev


As informed by [~accountid:5e9eab1e1f32260c13ee69fd]

nonEditableReason.message: The Parent Link is only available to Jira Premium users.

fields.summary: Migration plugin dependency from prod to Dev

comments.body:
The dependency collection of xpbframework has been restored in dev mongodb now. Please check and verify. [~accountid:712020:03d53fb6-c586-4b54-9884-6baa2eef6c21] 
And also as we discussed with [~accountid:6417eeb95534b0bf7441273a] 
1. please verify with data availability after each and every updates that are done in plugins, monet that are related to dependency, by this way we can corner the issue which will be helpful for the team.
2. And whomever from backend team working on xpbframework needs to check each and everytime for data availability after any update or migration. This is to prevent the  deletion of data from production server.  
This is critical and kindly br cautious.
CC: [~accountid:5c409ff58a78885a3c1afe6f]
Hi [~accountid:6417eeb95534b0bf7441273a] [~accountid:712020:03d53fb6-c586-4b54-9884-6baa2eef6c21] Please let me know the update on this.

Hii [~accountid:641c15e71273131f2ae27233] though it got restored yesterday evening,some other changes like deleting a component has been done from front end side and now if we are checking the same api, we can see that data is lost again.Even if someone is making changes like creating a component or deleting a component it shouldn’t affect this particular api.please do check the core issue for this and please resolve the same.

fields.customfield_10156:
The Applet n double-click should be able to open the grapesjs canvas in place of experience canvas and app should be editable
https://www.figma.com/file/jEyxF9mpDWuoQKqoM76a7K/Monet-September?type=design&node-id=2831-103560&mode=design&t=kB2porJKkHbGbEfG-0
fields.description:
# Applet is a new building block in Monet which is should be in action from Monet 2.0
Applet came into picture to prevent a major issue from Monet 1.0, where there will be multiple pages are developed and interacted in the same parent page i.e single app with multiple pages developed in a single canvas.
# Due to this, the app config is getting bulk and while processing it in client-side(Monet Framework) rendering the app takes long time which is not recommendable.
# So, Applet can be used as each page here in the experience canvas (each page can be developed individually) and can connect each page using Applet interactions given in the Experience Canvas. 



On double-click on this Applet, it should redirect to the Grapesjs Canvas where the respective page  will be editable

*Reference:*

!Screenshot from 2023-09-27 11-58-55.png|width=612,height=270!

nonEditableReason.message: The Parent Link is only available to Jira Premium users.

fields.summary: R&D and Create an Applet plugin as POC

fields.summary: Understanding of Grapejs Documentation for Custom styling (R&D)

comments.body:
Penpot stylings to be implemented in Grape JS -

Alignment -
Horizontal Left Align
Horizontal Center Align
Horizontal Right Align
Vertical Left Align
Vertical Center Align
Vertical Right Align

Size Preset -
Size
Orientation: Landscape, Potrait

Dimension -
Size: Width, Height
Position: X, Y
Rotation: deg
Border Radius: All corners, Individual Corners
Clip Content (Overflow Hidden)
Show in view mode

Layout -
Direction: Row, Column, Row Reverse, Column Reverse
Wrap: Wrap, No Wrap
Align: Start, Center, End
Justify: Start, Center, End, Space Between, Space Around, Space Evenly
Gap: Row, Column
Padding: Horizontal Padding, Vertical Padding, Individual Padding (top, right, bottom, left)

Flex Element -
Position: Static, Absolute, Z-Index
Sizing: Fix Width, Full Width, Fit Content (Width), Fix Height, Full Height, Fit Content (Height)
Align: Start, Center, End
Margin: Vertical Margin, Horizontal Margin, Individual Margin (top, right, bottom, left)
Min Width
Max Width

Layer -
Filter
Opacity
Hidden
Lock

Fill -
Background Color
Opacity

Stroke -
Border Color
Border Opacity
Border Width
Border Position: Center, Inside, Outside
Border Style: Solid, Dotted, Dashed, Mixed

Shadow -
Type: Drop Shadow, Inner Shadow
X, Y, Blur, Spread, Color, Opacity

Blur -
Value

Grid -
Type: Square, Column, Row
Number of Grids
Type: Stretch, Top, Center, Bottom
Gutter
Margin
Color
Opacity
Option: Use Default, Set As Default

Export -
Scale
Suffix Name
Type: JPEG, PNG, SVG


Deliverables by 6th October 2023 -

Dimension -
Size: Width, Height
Position: X, Y
Rotation: deg
Border Radius: All corners, Individual Corners
Clip Content (Overflow Hidden)
Show in view mode

Layout -
Direction: Row, Column, Row Reverse, Column Reverse
Wrap: Wrap, No Wrap
Align: Start, Center, End
Justify: Start, Center, End, Space Between, Space Around, Space Evenly
Gap: Row, Column
Padding: Horizontal Padding, Vertical Padding, Individual Padding (top, right, bottom, left)
